snippet: While consumer tech I.P.O.'s are down as much as 40 percent from their initial offering price, cloud-computing enterprise companies are doing fine. One reason the enterprise companies are doing better is that few of them are pioneering a new field...
abstract: While consumer tech I.P.O.'s are down as much as 40 percent from their initial offering price, cloud-computing enterprise companies are doing fine. One reason the enterprise companies are doing better is that few of them are pioneering a new field with uncertain economics as the consumer offerings are. The enterprise offerings hope to hollow out established incumbent companies already worth billions of dollars.

headline.main: The Bright Spot in Tech I.P.O.'s: Enterprise
